name: The Great Political Cliques (Jam edition)
description:
A short clicker/incremental game made for "Clicker Jam Spring 2023", inspired by "Will of the People".

Being a one-man team entirely consisting of a caveman-level-programmer, the game is a bit rough around the edges graphically.  I'm no Chris Crawford, but I think it's probably worth playing anyway.

I can beat it in a little under five minutes.  I think a new player who still has yet to explore the options and figure things out will take between ten and twenty minutes to win.

Programmed in LÖVE2d.  There's no native LOVE2d-To-Browser export option, and getting the various add-ons necessary to play nice is outside the scope of what I can get done during the Jam window, so the game is download only.  A source-code version is included if you don't trust .exe files from random people on the internet and want to review / compile it yourself to make sure there aren't any nasty surprises in the code.

The music used, "In Istanbul, on Bosphorus", was written and performed by Haris Abdagic and released without copyright.  Check out his copyrighted and copyright free work on Bandcamp - he has some good stuff out there, worth throwing a few bucks at him.

CONTROLS :
Left Click - Use your influence to shift society more left/right
Escape Key - Quit
Mouse Movement, Space Bar, Right Click - Can be unlocked via upgrades. A notification will explain the context of their use once they become available.

If you're into tabletop roleplaying, most of my itch entries are supplements and scenarios for Indy RPGs, mostly for the excellent FIST TTRPG.  I'm particularly proud of The Claudia Contingency.
